thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Wine maker's earnings may surprise

title: Wine maker's earnings may surprise
text:
Wed, Aug 19, 2015, 6:38 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 3 hrs 22 mins Wine maker's earnings may surprise AAP – 48 minutes ago Print 
Wine supplier and exporter Treasury Wine Estates' bottom line is likely to have been boosted by a lower Australian dollar. 
But of greater interest when it reports its annual financial results on Wednesday will be the company's efforts to make its supply chain more efficient, improve marketing and trim its portfolio of brands. 
Treasury Wine owns Penfolds, Beringer, Lindeman's, Wolf Blass and Rosemount Estate, among others. 
Morningstar analyst Farina Parsons says the company's results could surprise, given Treasury Wine had a good first half of the year year and some of its initiatives have shown some early benefits. 
Disappointing results in 2013/14 prompted Treasury Wine to change its structure, operating model and cost base. 
Chief executive Michael Clarke, who has been at the helm since April 2014, has described 2014/15 as "a re-set year". 
Other companies releasing financial results on Wednesday are energy giant Woodside Petroleum, telco iiNet, job ads group SEEK and discount retailer The Reject Shop. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Chinese travellers give Syd Airport a lift AAP
